meanings.definition: An area or region distinguished from adjacent parts by a distinctive feature or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The quiet zone in the library is where you can read without any noise.
meanings.sent2: I live in the residential zone of the city, where there are many houses.
meanings.sent3: The no-talking zone in the classroom made the students communicate through gestures.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a war zone, filled with conflicting thoughts and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The danger zone near the cliff was marked with warning signs.

meanings.definition: A specific district, area, or region.
meanings.sent1: The shopping zone in the mall has all the stores and boutiques.
meanings.sent2: The industrial zone of the city is where most factories are located.
meanings.sent3: The dessert zone at the party was the most popular spot with all the sweets.
meanings.sent4: His comfort zone was staying at home with his favorite book.
meanings.sent5: The end zone of the football field is where the players aim to score.

meanings.definition: A section of an area or territory marked off for a specific purpose or use.
meanings.sent1: The construction zone on the road had workers repairing the pavement.
meanings.sent2: The parking zone near the entrance is reserved for disabled visitors.
meanings.sent3: The play zone at the park is where children can have fun on the swings and slides.
meanings.sent4: Her comfort zone was her cozy corner with a cup of tea and a good book.
meanings.sent5: The study zone in the library is where students go to focus on their work.
